Posts.Content: Hello, I am having a 8 mm lump removed tommorow still very anxious about the whole procedure. I suffer from anxiety anyway but at the moment i am so overwhelmed with worry. I am also having the lymph node test done but the consultant has already said that they can't see anything there but have to do the test anyway just really looking for reassurance .thanks.
Posts.Title: Still very anxious about surgery tommorow

Posts.Content: Thanks for your support, I am just finding it all overwhelming but I am going out for a walk with my dog and try and forget about it, hope your keeping well. Xxxx
Posts.Title: Still very anxious about surgery tommorow

Posts.Content: Thanks so much lorna, it's good to talk with someone who understands anxiety, I will tell the nursing staff how I am feeling. will be thinking about you tommorow as well. Lots of love debbie
Posts.Title: Still very anxious about surgery tommorow

Posts.Content: Hi cat, Thanks for helping to reassure me. I will let everyone know how it went..take care. X
Posts.Title: Still very anxious about surgery tommorow

Posts.Content: Thanks Alan, you stay strong too.
Posts.Title: Still very anxious about surgery tommorow

Posts.Content: Hello everyone, I am going on Tuesday for my radiotherapy planning appointment which involves a ct scan. I start my radiotherapy on the 25th of feb, which involves 5 weeks of radiotherapy and hen an extra boost of 4days after, can anyone give me any advise or similar experience with what happened at there planning day, your help on here is such a comfort to me. Much love to everyone.xxx
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy planning

Posts.Content: Hello everyone, I was at the hospital on Tuesday for my follow up appointment after having my lumpectomy. Well the good news was that they had removed all the cancer, my margins were clear and none had spread to my lymph nodes. I am been given 4 weeks of radiotherapy which will start soon. I am also being put on tamoxifen for 5 years. Just looking for some advice on when the best time to take it and what's other peoples experience of it as well. Thanks for any help. Much love to everyone.
Posts.Title: tamoxifen advice

Posts.Content: Hello everyone, I had a 8mm lump removed by WLE last Tuesday and the pain has been very minimal. Today I have been experiencing a numb feeling under my arm , not really painful just numb, is this normal. I did have nodes biopsy with the blues dye as well but was told that from my ultra sound that they don't think there is anything under my arm, get all my results on the 28 th, as we all know the waiting is torture. Any advise on the numb feeling, thanks. Debbie
Posts.Title: numb feeling under arm after lumpectomy

Posts.Content: Hello everyone, I had a lumpectomy on the 14th of jan, with no cancer fund in lymph nodes, I am about to start radiotherapy and I have been on tamoxifen for 3 weeks, I was in the shower and noticed on y breast where I had the surgery a long vein type feeling under the breast, I looked at the image of the breast and think this might be a milk duct, anyone else experienced this, anyhelp much appreciated, much love to everyone.x
Posts.Title: Feeling in breast

Posts.Content: hello tabitha, I was diagnosed with a 8mm lump on the 13th of December and was told there that it was cancer before I even had my biopsy done, it was incredibly shocking and the first few days felt like I had been hit by a bus. I also went to the doc who gave me some tablets to help with the anxiety and they did make me calmer. I had a lumpectomy on the 15 th of January and all went well. The nurses and doctors are very understanding and will do there very best to help you. I go back on the 28th of January to find out what happens next which I think will be my radiotherapy and possibly hormone tablets. I am only 42 as well and as the time goes on and you understand what is happening to you it gets easier. Good luck with everything. Big hugs Debbie. X
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed - feeling lost

Posts.Content: Just wanted to saya thanks to everyone who has replied to me your experience and support has helped me greatly. Positive thinking.xxx
Posts.Title: Thanks so much for your support
update on my op yesterday which I was really anxious about

Posts.Content: Hello everyone Just letting everyone know that my op went really well, it was no way as bad as I imagined, to be honest it was relatively quite easy. I was so well looked after and cared for . The doctors and nurses are amazing. A lit bit sore today but not painful. Just going to enjoy watching my husband doing all the housework and cooking.lol.and Lorna I hope your chemo went ok. Best wishes and lots of love to everyone.xxxx
Posts.Title: update on my op yesterday which I was really anxious about

Posts.Content: So sorry, your chemo was cancelled. I have always found the deep breathing exercises to work when my anxiety is quite high, it might help you. You can find more details about this online. Take care.xxx
Posts.Title: update on my op yesterday which I was really anxious about
